title: When your Top Laner that took Ignite loses lane to the one that took Teleport

replies.body: Ignite doesn't mean auto win.

But it does mean you aren't as helpful if you fall behind. The guy with teleport can join the team easily at any time. The guy with ignite sacrifices his global pressure for kill pressure. By getting himself killed, the ignite basically relinquishes the advantage ignite gives him after he already sacrificed global pressure. On top of that, the guy with teleport is now a lot scarier because he won his land and will be more helpful in team fights as a result.

*teleports drag*
ignite man gets a tower
teleport comes back to lane
ignite man now has an advantage
kills teleport man
kills half of the inner tower

Thats what you plan for when you take ignite.

If you lose to tp man tho, better bite the pillow.
I usually take ignite on Volibear top and while I do usually win my lane, there have been games where I just either misplayed, or got camped and lost lane. Ignite isn't auto win lane

I didn't say it was.

I said you take if it you plan to stomp lane.
Planning doesn't always come out how you want it to come out

teleport or ignite? why not both?
http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/facebook/000/622/795/777.jpg

{{champion:59}} : Awww yiss _Ults without worries_

{{champion:122}} {{summoner:14}} {{summoner:12}} 

He may be 100% dead in ganks, but according to you he wins lane 100% of the time.

_J4 finds a lonely Darius at top lane_


{{champion:59}} : Kewl! No Flash Darius! Gonna gank his ass.... _Ults him_
{{champion:59}} : .......wait, this doesnt seem right.
{{champion:122}} : http://i.imgur.com/xiFfUnQ.gif _dunk ded_

Lulu can't really proc her passive on Darius without getting into Apprehend range.

Imo, there are way worse matchups for Darius.

Well, she can kite him, shield his damage, cancel his combo, and fuck up his ult with her ult.

Pretty bad match up. 

Not as bad as {{champion:10}} th0

Yeah, except the fact she will go OOM after two pulls or one if she was heavy at poking Darius.
Darius doesn't have that problem.
Plus you can always buy {{item:3009}} and it becomes a free lane.

A good lulu will trash a {{champion:122}}.

Lulu's kit will never give {{champion:122}} a chance to fight back. 

The {{champion:122}} would have to heavily  capitalize on {{champion:117}}'s mistakes in order to get a kill, but even then, he will be down in cs, and will still be bullied until he gets at least 2 more kills.

If you manage to do so, good job, your a good {{champion:122}}.
I'm actually a piss ass poor Darius, but Lulu matchup is easy mode.
{{champion:17}} like this, this lane is a nightmare
...I agree.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=J9Ecrn5X,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-07-25T06:59:17.051+0000)

> {{champion:122}} {{summoner:14}} {{summoner:12}}

> He may be 100% dead in ganks, but according to you he wins lane 100% of the time.

I tried this several times, and late game it heavily hurts you even more. Since you can't make Flash / Hook plays. And thats pretty much the only thing Darius is good for at the 25 minute mark.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=J9Ecrn5X,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-07-25T06:59:17.051+0000)
>
> {{champion:122}} {{summoner:14}} {{summoner:12}} 
> 
> He may be 100% dead in ganks, but according to you he wins lane 100% of the time.

Do this on champs who have some decent/spammable mobility like {{champion:86}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:120}} maybe even {{champion:77}}. You don't really have to worry about "if I'm ganked I'm fucked," cause you can just run back faster than they can get at you in some cases. You get the best of both worlds, it is hella fun.
{{champion:35}} {{champion:35}} you forgot the best top laner to tp ignite on {{champion:35}} {{champion:35}}
He does.
Please stop taking {{summoner:14}}  top.

Everyone knows there only 3 summoner spells now.
{{summoner:4}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:32}}

> [{quoted}](name=OperationDEEZ1,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=J9Ecrn5X,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-07-25T08:05:03.714+0000)
>
> Please stop taking {{summoner:14}}  top.

If you're very good at the champ you play and know that you will win, take ignite. This mostly applies to snowball champs like {{champion:92}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:107}}. You're better off getting really good at laning with these champs and snowballing lane with {{summoner:14}}, because what you want with these champs is kill pressure. {{summoner:12}} is better for laners that are actually good at teamfights, setting up ganks when they tp, and have good dragon control. This is also better for a champ that doesn't have good early, so this allows them to back safely to buy then pop back in lane. {{summoner:12}} isn't good on all champs and playstyles, stop enforcing the meta.

Enforcing the meta? I see ignite top a lot more than TP top. And I asked nicely :)
The only exception I'd think of is riven because she falls off hard unless she's 4/0.
League of Legends is a team game. And TP is just so much more useful to a team when it's utilized well.

> [{quoted}](name=OperationDEEZ1,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=J9Ecrn5X,comment-id=000600010001,timestamp=2015-07-25T20:18:06.818+0000)
>
> Enforcing the meta? I see ignite top a lot more than TP top. And I asked nicely :)
> The only exception I'd think of is riven because she falls off hard unless she's 4/0.
> League of Legends is a team game. And TP is just so much more useful to a team when it's utilized well.

I see more tp than ignite anymore, and I have even been kicked for not bringing tp as a top laner in teambuilder. People have this idea that {{summoner:12}} is a complete must for top lane. It's like if someone flamed you mid for taking {{summoner:6}} or {{summoner:7}} instead of {{summoner:14}}, but they are so stuck in a meta mentality that they don't realize there is more than one way to play this game.

preach it friend!! i find the number one problem people have against vlad is that they pick a sustain champ with tp into him. problem is that you will never ever be able tou outsustain vlad. instead take wukong with ignite top lane and outright kill vlad at lvl 2

> [{quoted}](name=MrSexyHobo,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=J9Ecrn5X,comment-id=000600010000,timestamp=2015-07-25T20:17:17.049+0000)
>
> preach it friend!! i find the number one problem people have against vlad is that they pick a sustain champ with tp into him. problem is that you will never ever be able tou outsustain vlad. instead take wukong with ignite top lane and outright kill vlad at lvl 2

Yep, prolonged trades and sustaining won't beat vlad. You need to all in him, so he can't even stay in lane anymore or outright kill him. Ignite helps make sure your all in is even stronger, so it helps against champs like hime.

"jungler gank muh lane"
"bro, you haven't helped with ONE dragon unlike TP dude"
"but I can carry"
You don't gank lanes because they've helped you. You gank lanes because it helps you and them to gank them.

Oh, I know

it's also their responsibility to help the team out too. Teleport really helps with that

but it's just a joke >_< I wouldn't abandon a lane just like that in a real game
+1 for ed edd n eddy
Not going to lie as a top laner who takes ignite a good amount of the time, it feels pretty bad losing that lane lol
meanwhile the laner with teleport went all over the map and always got kills, the other lanes never warded, and the top laner always pinged MIA.
What if I take tp and ignite?

{{summoner:14}} + {{summoner:12}} and a mobile champion. There, now there is no way you can lose that lane.
What about for those guys that use TP _and_ ignite?{{summoner:12}} {{summoner:14}} Like me? Its op :D

I always ganl if my top has ignite. He's more likely to snowball If he wins, plus, if the other guy starts losing, he will tp a lot, lose farm and lane pressure. When he come back,  your guy will easily snowball.
That's my face when I get a script for a cream that says something like "take 25 inches by mouth". Doctors are dumb lol.
